chart_metadata.name: emby
chart_metadata.description: Emby is designed to help you manage your personal media library, such as home videos and photos

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Emby is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Emby is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Emby is able to bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

groups.description: Configure User and Group for Emby

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Emby files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Emby files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description:
Bind to the host network. While it's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>
It's required for autodiscovery to work.

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description: The port for the Emby Web UI.

attrs.label: Emby Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Emby Configuration.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: The password for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Emby.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Emby.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Emby is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Emby is able to bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SYS_CHROOT
capabilities.description: Emby is able to use chroot.

capabilities.name: MKNOD
capabilities.description: Emby is able to create device nodes.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Emby is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: FSETID
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set file capabilities.

capabilities.name: KILL
capabilities.description: Emby is able to kill processes.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETPCAP
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set process capabilities.

capabilities.name: NET_BIND_SERVICE
capabilities.description: Emby is able to bind to privileged ports.

capabilities.name: SETFCAP
capabilities.description: Emby is able to set file capabilities.

capabilities.name: NET_RAW
capabilities.description: Emby is able to use raw sockets.

capabilities.name: AUDIT_WRITE
capabilities.description: Emby is able to write to audit log.

questions.label: CPU Limit
questions.description: CPU resource limit allow  plain integer values with suffix m(milli) e.g 1000m, 100.

questions.label: Memory Limit
questions.description: Memory limits is specified by number of bytes. Followed by quantity suffix like E,P,T,G,M,k and Ei,Pi,Ti,Mi,Gi,Ki can also be used. e.g 129e6, 129M,  128974848000m, 123Mi
